causality.effect: The device enters the acquisition phase and powers down. The conversion result is ready to be read.

causality.trigger: A falling edge on SDI (acting as Chip Select)
causality.effect: The SDO line is driven out of high impedance after tEN, and the Most Significant Bit (MSB, D15) of the conversion result becomes valid.
The next data bit is shifted out and becomes valid on the SDO pin after a propagation delay of tDSDO.
causality.condition: During a data read phase (SDI is low).

causality.effect: The SDO line returns to a high-impedance state after a delay of tDIS.
causality.condition: This terminates the current data read phase. It can happen at any time, but typically after the 16th bit is read.
If SDI does not go high first.

constraints.tCYC: Minimum Cycle Time. The total time for one full acquisition-conversion-readout cycle.
constraints.tCONV: Conversion Time. The duration of the analog-to-digital conversion process.
constraints.tACQ: Acquisition Time. The time required for the internal sample-and-hold capacitor to acquire the analog input voltage.
constraints.tSSDICNV: SDI setup time before CNV rising edge. SDI must be stable high for at least this duration before CNV goes high.
constraints.tHSDICNV: SDI hold time after CNV rising edge. SDI must remain stable high for at least this duration after CNV goes high.
constraints.tEN: SDO Enable Time. The delay from SDI falling edge to SDO driving the first bit (MSB). This is a causal delay/propagation time.
constraints.tDIS: SDO Disable Time. The delay from SDI rising edge to SDO entering a high-impedance state. This is a causal delay/propagation time.
constraints.tHSDO: SDO Hold Time. The minimum time the SDO data remains valid after the SCK falling edge.
constraints.tDSDO: SDO Data Delay Time. The maximum time it takes for SDO data to become valid after the SCK falling edge. This is a causal delay/propagation time.
constraints.tSCK: SCK Period. The duration of one clock cycle.
constraints.tSCKL: SCK Low Time. The minimum duration the SCK signal must be low.
constraints.tSCKH: SCK High Time. The minimum duration the SCK signal must be high.

states.description: The device's internal sample-and-hold circuit is tracking the analog input. This occurs before the CNV pulse and after the conversion is complete.
The device is actively converting the acquired analog voltage into a digital value. This state is initiated by the rising edge of CNV and lasts for tCONV.
The digital host is actively clocking out the conversion result. This state is initiated by bringing SDI low and clocking SCK. The SDO pin is actively driving data.
The SDO output pin is in a high-impedance state, allowing other devices to drive the shared data bus. This is the default state when the device is not selected (SDI is high).
